An answer to a followup question in our piece on why 
"Not even in Russia’s 2022 invasion of Ukraine was so much real-time data available about every move on the ground [as in Gaza]."
https://t.co/BJSVNLr96q

A matter of geography/population:

Ukraine is 233,000 square miles, with some areas dense but most not dense in population. There is fighting across a 600M front line and also strikes far behind it. 
In contrast, N. Gaza is 23 square miles (literally 5 orders of magnitude smaller), yet incredibly population dense.
